noun.description: A short, confused fight or struggle at close quarters.
examples: there were minor scuffles with police

noun.description: An act or sound of moving in a hurried, confused, or shuffling manner.
examples: he heard the scuffle of feet

verb.description: Engage in a short, confused fight or struggle at close quarters.
examples: the teacher noticed two students scuffling in the corridor

verb.description: Move in a hurried, confused, or awkward way, making a rustling or shuffling sound.
examples: a drenched woman scuffled through the doorway

origin: Late 16th century (as a verb): probably of Scandinavian origin; compare with Swedish skuffa to push; related to shove and shuffle.
